flawed_nl_solution:
Nurse Missy has 12*(1/3)=<<12*(1/3)=4>>4 special needs patients.
She has 12-4=<<12-4=8>>8 standard care patients.
Special needs patients take 20% longer to serve, which means serving takes 1.2*5=6.0 minutes per patient.
To serve dinner to all of her standard care patients, it will take 5*8=<<5*8=40>>40 minutes.
To serve dinner to all of her special needs patients, it will take 6.0*4=<<6.0*4=42.0>>42.0 minutes.
In total, it will take 40+42.0=<<40+42.0=82.0>>82.0 minutes to serve dinner to all of her patients.

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 24.0, not 42.0. It appears two adjacent digits were swapped.
